examples.sentence: Physical movement away while doing an action
Gradual change continuing into the future
Actions that will continue from now on
〜てくる (te-kuru) - Motion towards/change up to now
〜ていく vs 〜てくる - Directional comparison
Future Expressions - Talking about the future

sections.heading: What is 〜ていく (te-iku)?
sections.content:
〜ていく combines the te-form with いく (to go) and expresses:

Physical movement away while doing an action Gradual change continuing into the future Actions that will continue from now on

[Verb te-form] + いく 持っていく "take (away)" 変わっていく "gradually change / change going forward"

children.heading: Basic Pattern
children.content: Verb (te-form) + いく Plain: 〜ていく Polite: 〜ていきます 持っていく / 持っていきます "take (away)" 変わっていく / 変わっていきます "change gradually"

children.heading: 1. Physical Movement Away
children.content:
Doing an action while moving away from the speaker.

持っていく "take (something with you)" 連れていく "take (someone with you)" 運んでいく "carry away" 送っていく "take/escort (someone)"

children.heading: 2. Gradual Change (Future Direction)
children.content:
Change happening progressively into the future.

寒くなっていく "gradually become cold" 変わっていく "gradually change" 良くなっていく "gradually get better" 増えていく "gradually increase"

children.heading: 3. Continuation into Future
children.content:
Actions that will continue from now on.

これから頑張っていく "I'll do my best from now on" 勉強していく "continue studying (into the future)" 働いていく "continue working"

children.heading: Taking Things
children.content: お弁当を持っていく "take a lunch box (with me)" 傘を持っていく "take an umbrella" 荷物を運んでいく "carry luggage away"

children.heading: Taking People
children.content: 子供を学校に連れていく "take a child to school" 友達を駅まで送っていく "take a friend to the station"

children.heading: Versus てくる (Direction)
children.content: ていく: Away from speaker 持っていく - "take (away)" てくる: Toward speaker 持ってくる - "bring (here)"

children.heading: Natural Changes
children.content: 日が暮れていく "the sun gradually sets" 季節が変わっていく "seasons gradually change" 寒くなっていく "gradually get cold" 暗くなっていく "gradually get dark"

children.heading: Progressive Development
children.content: 上手になっていく "gradually improve" 大きくなっていく "gradually grow bigger" 有名になっていく "gradually become famous" 人気が出ていく "gradually become popular"

children.heading: Deterioration
children.content: 悪くなっていく "gradually worsen" 古くなっていく "gradually age" 忘れていく "gradually forget"

children.heading: Determination
children.content: これから頑張っていきます "I'll do my best from now on" 一生懸命働いていく "I'll work hard (going forward)" 努力していく "I'll continue making efforts"

children.heading: Plans
children.content: 日本語を勉強していく "I'll continue studying Japanese" この仕事を続けていく "I'll continue this work" 成長していく "I'll continue growing"

children.heading: これから (from now on)
children.content: これから変わっていく "will gradually change from now" これから頑張っていきます "I'll do my best from now on"

children.heading: だんだん (gradually)
children.content: だんだん良くなっていく "gradually get better" だんだん難しくなっていく "gradually become more difficult"

children.heading: どんどん (more and more)
children.content: どんどん増えていく "increase more and more" どんどん成長していく "grow more and more"

sections.heading: Comparison: ていく vs てくる

children.heading: ていく (Away/Future)
children.content: Physical: 持っていく "take (away)" Change: 寒くなっていく "get colder (going forward)" Future: 頑張っていく "do my best (from now)"

children.heading: てくる (Toward/Past to Present)
children.content: Physical: 持ってくる "bring (here)" Change: 寒くなってきた "has gotten colder (up to now)" Approach: 春が来る "spring is coming"

children.heading: Key Difference
children.content: ていく: Focus on future progression てくる: Focus on change up to now

children.heading: Movement
children.content: 持っていく - take 連れていく - take (person) 運んでいく - carry away 送っていく - escort/take

children.heading: Change
children.content: 変わっていく - change gradually なっていく - become gradually 増えていく - increase gradually 減っていく - decrease gradually

children.heading: Development
children.content: 成長していく - grow/develop 進んでいく - progress 発展していく - develop 広がっていく - spread

children.heading: 〜ていかない
children.content: 変わっていかない "won't change" 良くなっていかない "won't get better"

children.heading: 〜ていかなければならない
children.content: 変わっていかなければならない "must change (going forward)" 頑張っていかなければならない "must work hard (from now on)"

children.heading: 〜ていった
children.content: だんだん寒くなっていった "gradually got colder" 変わっていった "gradually changed" 成長していった "grew gradually"

children.heading: Example 1: Taking Something
children.content: A: 明日のピクニック、何を持っていく？ "What will you take to tomorrow's picnic?" B: お弁当と飲み物を持っていきます "I'll take lunch and drinks" A: 私は果物を持っていくね "I'll take fruit"

children.heading: Example 2: Gradual Change
children.content: A: 天気はどう？ "How's the weather?" B: だんだん暑くなっていくね "It's gradually getting hotter" A: 夏が近づいているね "Summer is approaching"

children.heading: Example 3: Future Determination
children.content: A: これからどうする？ "What will you do from now?" B: 一生懸命勉強していきます "I'll study hard from now on" A: 頑張ってね "Do your best"

children.heading: Example 4: Describing Change
children.content: A: 日本語、上手になったね "Your Japanese has improved" B: ありがとう。これからももっと上手になっていきたい "Thanks. I want to continue improving from now on"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Confusing direction with てくる
children.content: Context: Taking something away Wrong: 持ってくる ❌ Right: 持っていく ✓ "take (with me)"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using for completed changes
children.content: Context: Already changed Less natural: 変わっていく ⚠️ More natural: 変わった ✓ "changed" Note: ていく emphasizes ongoing/future process

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong context for movement
children.content: Context: Someone bringing something to you Wrong: 持っていく ❌ Right: 持ってくる ✓ "bring (here)"

children.heading: Emphasizing Process
children.content: 良くなっていく "get better (emphasizing the process)" vs. 良くなる "get better (simple change)"

children.heading: Future Perspective
children.content: 頑張っていく "work hard (from now into future)" vs. 頑張る "work hard (general)"

children.heading: 〜ていくつもり (intend to continue)
children.content: 日本に住んでいくつもりです "I intend to continue living in Japan"

children.heading: 〜ていくだろう (will probably continue)
children.content: 人口は増えていくだろう "The population will probably continue increasing"

children.heading: 〜ていくべき (should continue)
children.content: 努力していくべきだ "should continue making efforts"

children.heading: I-adjectives
children.content: 寒くなっていく "gradually become cold" 難しくなっていく "gradually become difficult" 良くなっていく "gradually get better"

children.heading: Na-adjectives
children.content: 便利になっていく "gradually become convenient" 有名になっていく "gradually become famous" きれいになっていく "gradually become beautiful"

children.heading: Seasonal Changes
children.content: 春になっていく "spring is coming/approaching" 日が長くなっていく "days gradually get longer" 葉が落ちていく "leaves gradually fall"

children.heading: Time Progression
children.content: 時間が過ぎていく "time passes" 年を取っていく "grow older"

children.heading: Casual
children.content: 持っていく "I'll take it" 変わっていく "it'll change"

children.heading: Polite
children.content: 持っていきます "I'll take it" 変わっていきます "it'll change"

children.heading: Formal/Determined
children.content: 頑張っていきたいと思います "I would like to work hard going forward"

children.heading: Physical Movement
children.content: 荷物を部屋に運んでいく "carry luggage to the room" 子供を学校に連れていく "take the child to school" お弁当を持っていく "take a lunch box" 友達を駅まで送っていく "take a friend to the station"

children.heading: Gradual Change
children.content: だんだん寒くなっていく "gradually get colder" 人口が増えていく "population gradually increases" 技術が発展していく "technology gradually develops" 季節が変わっていく "seasons gradually change"

children.heading: Future Continuation
children.content: これから頑張っていきます "I'll do my best from now on" 日本語を勉強していく "I'll continue studying Japanese" 努力していくつもりです "I intend to continue making efforts" 成長していきたい "I want to continue growing"

children.heading: Natural Changes
children.content: 日が暮れていく "the sun sets" 花が咲いていく "flowers bloom" 時間が経っていく "time passes"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: 〜てくる (te-kuru) - Motion towards/change up to now Te-form Conjugation - Basic te-form 〜ていく vs 〜てくる - Directional comparison Change & Transformation - Expressing change Future Expressions - Talking about the future Volitional Form - Expressing intention
